description: Authorities are struggling to stop smugglers moving drugs over the Greek-Albanian border.
title: Why Europe's big cannabis route is so hard to shut
title_page: Why Europe's big cannabis route is so hard to shut - BBC News
maintext: "Cannabis is trafficked on foot by Albanians who live in villages on the other side of the border," says Greek officer Lambros Tsoumanis, who spends much of his time patrolling these mountains. "They are hardy, tough people and know all the crossings like the back of their hand. They can survive for days in the forest."
